item.title: Getting Started
item.description: AuthProbe helps you isolate exactly where MCP OAuth fails. Use this path to onboard quickly: Install the AuthProbe CLI. Run the quickstart scan command. Use verification commands to confirm your fix. Continue with Install and Quickstart.

item.title: Install
item.description: Install AuthProbe using your preferred package workflow for your environment. After installation, verify the CLI is available: authprobe --help Then continue to Quickstart.

item.title: Quickstart
item.description: Run your first scan against an MCP endpoint with OAuth enabled: authprobe scan --target https://mcp.example.com --auth oauth --verbose Review the findings to identify where the OAuth exchange fails, then run the provided verification commands after remediation.

item.title: CI / GitHub Action
item.description: Use AuthProbe in CI to detect MCP OAuth regressions before deployment. This page is a starter stub and can be expanded with your repository’s workflow specifics.

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: If scans fail unexpectedly, start by rerunning with verbose output and checking the deterministic findings. This page is a starter stub and can be expanded with common failure signatures and fixes.
